oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Fontana Dam on the Little Tennessee River
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This photograph shows the Fontana Dam, which was built in North Carolina off of the Little Tennessee River by the Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA) to power the aluminum factories of ALCOA and the plants of the Clinton Engineer Works at Oak Ridge during World War II.

Construction for Fontana Dam began in 1942 and was completed in 1944. It is the tallest dam in the Eastern United States at a height of 480 feet, and it was the fourth tallest dam in the world at its time of completion.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tennessee Valley Authority
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976 (RG 82)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Fontana Dam (N.C.); Dams; Hydroelectric power plants; World War, 1939-1945
Dams; Hydroelectric generators; Hydroelectric power
